sentences: Ma ei tea, kellega ta räägib.
context: The word 'kellegagi' is an Estonian adessive-illative case combination. It's formed from the pronoun 'keegi' (someone) and the suffix '-ga' (with, in accompaniment). This construction indicates accompaniment or being in company with someone. The '-gi' particle adds emphasis to the accompanying person. It's commonly used when describing actions done together with an unspecified person.
